title: Can you become a lawyer with a politics degree? - Quora

response.answer_text: All that matters is going to a law school land then passing the bar. BTW, I once looked into this. Technically, you can still become a lawyer the old fashioned way, as Abe Lincoln did, without law school, although fewer than 1% of lawyers do that today. So, without going to law school it’s still possible if you: Pass the bar exam.Find a law firm to endorse you. Generally, this means you are going to have to apprentice as a para-legal for a while.But generally, you need a law degree from an accredited law school in the USA (or whatever country you’re going to practice in). To get into law school, the minimum requirement is generally that you have a four-year degree of some kind (Bachelor’s). However it absolutely doesn’t have to be politics or “pre-law.” You’re better off majoring in just about anything that you can get high grades in. Although, the premiere law schools want to know if you can write papers… so English or other humanities degrees do have an edge there. Interesting note: In the film “Catch Me if You Can,” Leo DiCaprio’s character passes the bar, and qualifies to be a lawyer, without going to college or law school. When asked how he passed the bar exam, he says that he just studied very hard for it! Of course, that character was practically a genius.

You can become a lawyer with any degree, from archeology to zoology, and everything in between as long as your university grades show that you can think and your SAT scores are good enough to be admitted to law school, which you must complete with a degree, of course. After law school you then must past the biggest test of all, the state bar exam, which determines whether or not you can practice as a lawyer or just have a degree from a law school.

Only if you supplement it with a law degree. In the United States, where you live, an undergraduate degree in political science will make you eligible to enroll in law school. Once you graduate from law school and pass the bar examination, you can become a lawyer.
You can become a Dr of Political Science (PhD) but to practice law you must have a law degree (JD) and also pass the Bar in the area of practice.
US LAW: Yes, of course. You will have to go to law school, and then pass bar exams in every state where you want to practice.
